subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Madam C.J. Walker: America's First Self-Made Female Millionaire
description: A short lesson to help you apply Madam C.J. Walker: America's First Self-Made Female Millionaire.

hook.text: Born to formerly enslaved parents in 1867, Sarah Breedlove became America's first self-made female millionaire.

buildup.text: After developing a scalp condition, she created her own line of hair care products for Black women.

discovery.text: She built a direct-sales empireâ€”training thousands of 'Walker Agents' who sold door to door.

twist.text: She invented the direct-sales model decades before Avon or Mary Kay popularized it.

climax.text: Walker used her wealth for philanthropy and civil rights activism, funding schools and organizations.

punchline.text: She built an empire in a world designed to stop her.

quiz.question: What business model innovation did Madam C.J. Walker pioneer?
options: A direct-sales force of trained agents selling door to door
Mass production of beauty products in factories
Mail-order catalog sales across the country
